alert.note: Alert for Howard (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 12 at 10:14PM CDT until April 12 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN HOWARD...SOUTHEASTERN MOWER AND WESTERN FILLMORE COUNTIES... At 1013 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Le Roy, or 18 miles west of Preston, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Spring Valley around 1030 PM CDT. Wykoff around 1040 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Lake Louise State Park, Chester, Forestville State Park, Etna, York, Bristol and Cherry Grove. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for north central and northeastern Iowa...and southeastern Minnesota. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
